intro: Moraea thermarum, commonly known as the hot spring moraea, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils near hot springs or in dry, sunny habitats. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its unique habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
